page.title: 19OLD BUILDINGS IN ST VEEP
page.content: There aren't any grand old buildings in the area apart from the {churches,}but there are several buildings which are of interest. These tend to be buildings which when they were built were used for purposes for which there is no longer any need. The old granary, mill, boat house and blacksmith's are now homes. {Lime kilns}can still be seen in {Lerryn.}One is now a ruin, but the other has been converted into a dwelling. {St. Cadix,}at the head of St. Cyric's creek, is the site of a Celtic hermitage founded by St. Carroc. In the 12th century it became a{priory with a prior and one monk. In 1556 the site was used for smelting tin. A house still stands on the site today and links from its past can still be found.
